titleStmt.author: Saunders, Jourdan M.

For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Letter] 1833 Feb. 12, Warrenton, Virginia [to] D. Burford / J. Saunders
bibl.author: Saunders, Jourdan M.
bibl.note: This document is a letter dated February 12, 1833 from J. Saunders in Warrenton, Virginia to David Burford. The subject of the letter is slave trade and demand.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p:
I this moment recd received your letter of the 28th Jany January :__Williams letter has not come to hand__ The letter I enclosd enclosed you from James R Franklin will give you some idea of the demand for slaves, they are at this time higher in this country than I have ever known there since I have been in the Trade, We are now preparing to make a shipment which will be third time since the RT of Nov November . last, consequently you see that I shall have no difficulty in finding a place
for all I have on hand__

Your order upon the subject of your funds shall be attended to as soon as I can procure a check of the right suit for the philadelphia money market, having made use of the one you sent me, of which you shall be duly advised__
In answer to your inquiry upon the subject of mary & her child, I will only remark that you can have them for $500
